column4: France to consider long-term ADP concession before sale: report
column5: PARIS The French government is considering awarding a long-term concession to Paris airport operator ADP  because of land ownership issues  prior to a possible sale of a controlling stake  business daily Les Echos said.

column4: France to consider long-term ADP concession before sale -report
column5: PARIS  Dec 17 The French government is considering awarding a long-term concession to Paris airport operator ADP because of land ownership issues  prior to a possible sale of a controlling stake  business daily Les Echos said.

column4: CSX CEO Harrison dies months into railroad's turnaround effort
column5: NEW YORK CSX Corp  Chief Executive Hunter Harrison has died  the freight railway operator said on Saturday  just a few days after announcing that the veteran rail executive hired earlier this year to boost its profits had taken a medical leave of absence.

column4: Equinix to buy Australia's Metronode data center group for $791 million
column5: SYDNEY U.S. data center group Equinix Inc on Monday said it was buying Australian data center company Metronode from the Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan in an all-cash deal worth A$1.035 billion ($791.15 million).

column4: Equinix to buy Australia's Metronode data centre group for $791 mln
column5: SYDNEY  Dec 18 U.S. data centre group Equinix Inc on Monday said it was buying Australian data centre company Metronode from the Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan in an all-cash deal worth A$1.035 billion ($791.15 million).

column4: UPDATE 1-Ryanair unions lift Christmas strike threat
column5: DUBLIN  Dec 17 Unions representing Ryanair pilots in Ireland and Portugal on Sunday suspended plans to strike before Christmas  lifting the threat of industrial action at the low-cost giant after it agreed on Friday to recognise trade unions for the first time.

column4: Ryanair pilots in Ireland suspend strike planned for Wednesday
column5: DUBLIN  Dec 17 Ryanair pilots in Ireland on Sunday suspended a 24-hour strike planned for Wednesday  the final strike threat facing the airline in the busy run-up to Christmas  trade union Impact said in a statement.

column4: Ryanair offers to meet Irish pilots ahead of strike date
column5: DUBLIN Ryanair has proposed talks with an Irish pilot union before a possible Wednesday strike in a bid to remove the last threat to its Christmas schedule after its surprise offer to recognize unions for the first time.

column4: Ryanair offers to meet Irish pilots ahead of strike date
column5: DUBLIN  Dec 17 Ryanair has proposed talks with an Irish pilot union before a possible Wednesday strike in a bid to remove the last threat to its Christmas schedule after its surprise offer to recognise unions for the first time.

column4: U.S. employers say CVS-Aetna deal would affect health-benefits decisions: survey
column5: NEW YORK CVS Corp’s proposed purchase of Aetna Inc will affect decision-making by a majority of large and mid-size U.S. corporations on employee health benefits  a survey by benefits consultant Aon Plc found.

column4: U.S. employers say CVS-Aetna deal would affect health-benefits decisions -survey
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 17 CVS Corp’s proposed purchase of Aetna Inc will affect decision-making by a majority of large and mid-size U.S. corporations on employee health benefits  a survey by benefits consultant Aon Plc found.

column4: UPDATE 2-Strike over Teva Pharm job cuts briefly shuts down Israel
column5: JERUSALEM  Dec 17 Israel's main public-sector labour union staged a half-day strike on Sunday  closing the airport  stock exchange  banks and all government ministries to protest at mass layoffs planned by Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.

column4: Strike briefly shuts down Israel over Teva Pharm job cuts
column5: JERUSALEM  Dec 17 Israel's main public-sector labour union went on a half-day strike on Sunday  closing the airport  the stock exchange  banks and all government ministries as part of a protest against mass layoffs planned by Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.

column4: BHP and Esso to separately market Gippsland Basin gas -regulator
column5: Dec 18 The Australian Competition & Consumer Commission (ACCC) said on Monday that BHP and Exxon Mobil would separately market their respective shares of gas produced from their Gippsland Basin joint venture from 2019.

column4: Humana in talks to buy Kindred Healthcare with equity firms: source
column5: NEW YORK U.S. health insurer Humana Inc  is in advanced talks to acquire acute care provider Kindred Healthcare Inc  in partnership with private equity firms Welsh  Carson  Anderson & Stowe and TPG  a source familiar with the matter said on Sunday.

column4: M&T Bank's CEO Robert Wilmers dies: bank
column5: NEW YORK M&T Bank's chairman and chief executive officer  Robert Wilmers  died on Saturday night at home after nearly 35 years leading the Buffalo  New York-based company  the bank said on Sunday.

column4: M&T Bank's CEO Robert Wilmers dies -bank
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 17 M&T Bank's chairman and chief executive officer  Robert Wilmers  died on Saturday night at home after nearly 35 years leading the Buffalo  New York-based company  the bank said on Sunday.

column4: Aconex receives $1.19 bln takeover offer from Oracle Corp
column5: Dec 18 Aconex Ltd said on Monday it had received a A$1.56 billion ($1.19 billion)  A$7.80 in cash per share  buyout offer from U.S. software major Oracle Corp .
